questions.uddipok:
Read the passage and write the antonyms or synonyms of the words as directed below.

The process of globalization obviously requires a common language for international communication. For many different reasons, English has achieved the prestige of being that language. As a result, it has crossed national borders to reach people who speak other languages. It is no longer the unique possession of British or American people, but a language that belongs to the world's people. In fact, bilingual and multilingual users of English far outnumber its monolingual native speakers. This phenomenon has led to a bewildering variety of English around the world. As more and more people speak English, more and more varieties have emerged which are strongly influenced by the pronunciation, grammar and idioms of the respective mother tongues. World English has now moved away from the control of the native speakers. However, the question of British or American English is not so important now. Today's slogan is mutual intelligibility among users of the language.

(a) obviously (synonym); (b) obviously (antonym); (c) prestige (synonym); (d) phenomenon (synonym); (e) unique (antonym); (f) belong (synonym); (g) outnumber (synonym); (h) monolingual (antonym); (i) native (antonym); (j) variety (synonym); (k) emerge (antonym); (l) control (antonym) (m) bewildering (synonym); (n) intelligibility (antonym).

sub_questions.explanation: (a) obviously (synonym) — clearly (b) obviously (antonym) — doubtfully/vague (c) prestige (synonym) — honor / reputation (d) phenomenon (synonym) — event / occurrence (e) unique (antonym) — common / ordinary (f) belong (synonym) — possess / be part of (g) outnumber (synonym) — exceed / surpass (h) monolingual (antonym) — bilingual / multilingual (i) native (antonym) — foreign / non-native (j) variety (synonym) — diversity / kind / type (k) emerge (antonym) — disappear / vanish (l) control (antonym) — freedom / submission / surrender (m) bewildering (synonym) — confusing / puzzling (n) intelligibility (antonym) — incomprehensibility / obscurity

The integration of multimedia resources such as projectors, smart boards, and audiovisual equipment can greatly enrich the educational experience by making lessons more engaging, interactive, and accessible to diverse learning styles.
Multimedia facilities in classrooms would enable instructors to incorporate a variety of teaching aids such as educational videos, interactive presentations, and digital simulations into their lectures. This would not only capture the attention of students but also facilitate better understanding and retention of complex concepts.

Therefore, I urge you to consider this proposal favorably and take the necessary steps to implement multimedia facilities in our college classrooms.
Thank you for considering my suggestion. I am confident that this initiative will greatly benefit the academic community at X College and contribute to the overall enhancement of our educational experience.

questions.uddipok: Nowadays, Pahela Boishakh has become a part of our national history,, culture and tradition. Write a paragraph on "The Celebration of Pahela Boishakh" showing its significance.

sub_questions.explanation: Pahela Boishakh, the first day of the Bengali New Year, is not just a celebration of the passing of time but a vibrant reflection of Bangladesh's rich cultural heritage and national identity. Celebrated on April 14th each year, this festival marks the beginning of the new year in the Bengali calendar, which holds deep historical significance. Rooted in centuries-old traditions, Pahela Boishakh brings together people from all walks of life, transcending religious and social boundaries. The day is celebrated with great enthusiasm through various cultural events, parades, and gatherings, with the iconic sight of people wearing traditional attire, particularly the colorful sarees for women and panjabis for men. The celebration also features the consumption of special foods, such as panta bhat (fermented rice) with hilsa fish, and the practice of "alpona" (decorating homes with colorful patterns), all of which symbolize prosperity, happiness, and a fresh start. Moreover, Pahela Boishakh serves as a reminder of the importance of unity and the collective spirit of the Bengali people, as it has evolved into a secular celebration of culture, literature, and the arts. The day is also a time for reflection and renewal, where people take the opportunity to let go of past grievances, embrace new beginnings, and celebrate the resilience and beauty of Bengali traditions. Whether in the streets of Dhaka or the villages across the country, the celebration of Pahela Boishakh is a testament to the enduring spirit of the Bangladeshi people and their deep connection to their cultural roots.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "Nuclear Family Versus Extended Family".

sub_questions.explanation:
Living in a Nuclear Family and an Extended Family
I live in an extended family. Despite having some problems, I am happy. But nowadays, nuclear families are increasing in numbers. Our life has become very busy. At the same time, being bound to live in cities in search of income, people have become detached from their parents, grandparents, uncles, aunts and cousins. They live in cities with their wives and children only. But life in cities is not so easy nowadays. So, with the gradual increase of the price of daily commodities, they cannot send money to the extended families in villages. In a nuclear family, children can grow up in a suitable environment. There they are brought up soundly. But in reality, the children in a nuclear family feel lonely. They cannot share their feelings with others. Their parents remain busy most of the time. So, they become mentally upset. Human mind is very sensitive. So, everyone wants to have someone to share one's distress and happiness. I don't support a nuclear family, because in it, family members become self- centered in most cases. It is, in fact, a reality of modern life that people become bound to form a nuclear family in the long distant cities.
